course.subject: MATH
course.name: Mathematical Analysis
course.description: Sets and functions, real numbers, limits of sequences and series, limits of functions, continuous functions, differentiation, Riemann integration, additional topics.
course.prerequisites: A passing grade in AL Pure Mathematics / AL Applied Mathematics; OR MATH 1014 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1024

KIN LI 比哂lecture video我地, 所以無必要上9點堂, 基本上可以唔洗睇video, 直睇lecture notes 同 操past papers已經可以拎到高分.

reviews.author: Trevis@MATH
reviews.title: 同Kin Li's style好唔同
reviews.comment_content:
Coverage of the course:
1. Sets, functions, countability, equivalence classes.
2. Construction of Q and R via equivalence relation.
3. Convergence in R and topology on R.
4. Infinite series.
5. Metric space.

Contents (Lecture Notes):
* 1  Sets and functions
    * 1.1  Sets
    * 1.2  Cartesian product
    * 1.3  Power set
    * 1.4  Functions
    * 1.5  Counting
    * 1.6  Equivalence relation
    * 1.7  Construction the rational numbers from integers 
* 2  Real numbers
    * 2.1 Construction of real numbers from rational numbers
    * 2.2 Least upper bound property
    * 2.3 Convergence in R
    * 2.4 Topology on R 
* 3  Infinite series 
* 4  Metric space
    * 4.1 Definition
    * 4.2 Topology on metric spaces
    * 4.3 Convergence and completeness
    * 4.4 Space of functions
    * 4.5 Continuous functions
    * 4.6 Compactness
    * 4.7 The contraction mapping theorem
    * 4.8 Weierstrass Theorem

reviews.author: Patricknely
reviews.title: How to learn this course properly?
reviews.comment_content:
Hello, students who have to take this course :)
This review is focused on the proper way to learn this course.

The content coverage:
> Logic and Sets
  * Countability
> Infinite Series
> Real Numbers
  * Infimum and Supremum
> Limit of Sequences
  * Infimum and Supremum Limit Theorem
  * Monotone Sequence Theorem
  * Cauchy Sequence
> Limit of Functions
  * Intermediate Value Theorem
  * Extreme Value Theorem
  * Continuous Injection Theorem
> Differentiation
  * Mean Value Theorem
  * Taylor's Theorem
> * Riemann Integral
  * Integral Criterion
  * Measure 0 (Lebesgue's Theorem)

Important concepts are marked as *, please make sure you get familiar with those concepts and theorems before midterm or final. Proofs of the theorem are taught in the lecture but they are totally useless for exams, you can skip this part when you rewatching the recording.

The materials is basically an extension from MATH1014, however the homework and exams are more focused on *proof*. Calculations (like calculating the inifinte series or improper integrals) don't exist in final and midterm.

The last chapter is quite difficult to understand, don't mix up the concept of U(f, P) and U(f), one represents the upper sum and the other represents the upper integral.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Attending lectures is not helpful through studying this course. Dr. KU and Dr. LKY (according to my friends) just read the notes line by line, words by words.

Dr. KU solves one problem (clearly he forgets how to solve the problem) by using 60 minutes, hard to believe right?

Just learn the material by yourself or watching recording in 2.0 speed.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grades are shit.
You need to be very familiar with the applications of the theorems (marked as * above) by exercising a LOT, if you want +1 SD in exams.

This course promised an "absolute grading", but the final grades are totally dependent on how well does the students perform. The threshold is always lowered by a great amount (~10%, I think)

Statistics

> Midterm
Mean = 36 out of 100
SD = 22 out of 100
Mean for Paper A = 18 out of 50
Mean for Paper B = 17 out of 50

> Final
Paper A: Mean = 22.07 SD = 12.28
Paper B: Mean = 17.58 SD = 12.16
Final Exam Total: Mean = 39.65 SD = 22.71

TOTAL: Mean = 46.99% SD = 20.20%

About the topic of the problems of exams:
> Midterm
* Countability
* Find the infimum and supremum of a given set
* Prove the limit of sequence by definition
* Limit of recurrence relations, e.g. a_n = 2a_{n-1} + 1
* Continuous Injection Theorem

> Final
* Cauchy Sequence
* Differentiability and Taylor Theorem
* Integral Criterion
* Continuity

You can find all pastpapers on petergao or coursehero. The old exams follow the same pattern of question types. However, the recent years' midterm and final are quite different from the past exams, I think it's still helpful if you practice them.

The grading is not the problem in this course, the problem is students are so chur and competitive :(

*** Update 28/5 ***
Mean is around C+ according to the comment
reviews.comment_workload:
Here I will share how to learn this course to get a good grade.
1. The tutorials are very very important, the problems are quite similar to the exam problems.
2. The proof and exercises of the lecture nots are completely useless. Writing the proof step by step is a waste of time, just understand them is good enough, or sometimes you just don't need to understand them and plainly use them for solving problems.
3. Find practice questions here https://www.math.hkust.edu.hk/~makyli/2033/Presenation%20Exercises_150128.pdf
4. Download the pastpapers and earlier resources from petergao or coursehero https://www.coursehero.com/sitemap/schools/79634-The-Hong-Kong-University-of-Science-and-Technology/courses/4751233-MATH2033/?__chid=c312a613-3906-4330-9607-8289fcd3bc44.

If you aim for B range, try to do 1 and practice some problems in 3. If you aim higher, then do all these steps. It takes me 3~4 days to prepare before exams,

:( I still need to learn 3033, for fuck sake.

reviews.title: Direct proof, proof by MI, proof by contradiction, ...
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm Coverage:
1. Countability problem
2. Supremum/infimum of sets
3. Recurrence relation sequences (monotone type or back-and-forth type)
4. Limit of sequence by checking the (epsilon and K) definition

Final Coverage:
1. Cauchy sequences
2. Limit of functions
3. Theorems on continuous functions
4. Theorems on differentiable functions
5. Theorems on Riemann integrable functions
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kin Li幾好人 佢會upload lecture videos 所以可以唔洗二四上9點堂 臨考前係屋企開1.5速煲兩日就睇晒

當中有啲theorems佢介紹過但唔會考 (e.g. sign preserving property, local tracing theorem, ...) 亦都有好多theorems嘅proof唔洗知 正係要識點apply去prove一啲statements (e.g. intermediate value theorem, mean value theorem, ...) 但有興趣嘅話 理解左會融匯貫通好多

仲有臨考前佢會有midterm/final review session 專心聽佢講考試技巧都幾有用

如果溫midterm/final同埋做homework嗰陣有問題 可以email問佢 或者直接上佢office請教 佢會好樂意解答你

唯一我覺得唔太好嘅係Kin Li嘅solution寫法有陣時好唔consistent 細微啲嘅可能係recurrence relation sequences佢會將<同<=撈亂用 明顯啲嘅可能係countability部份答案可以直接用product theorem + countable union theorem做 佢有時會轉用define new function + bijection theorem + countable union theorem做 變相麻煩好多 去到後面continuity同integrability啲解題步驟都有少少唔一致
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade Scheme:
Homeworks 5%
Presentations 10%
Midterm 30%
Final 55%

前三者都比較容易拎接近滿分嘅分數 係final嗰5題入面嘅尾3題較為難 除左靠經驗之外 仲要有觸覺先做到 每年問法都唔同 其實都係用返類似材料構造

Grade by Curve
top ~ 15% A+ to A-
next ~25% B+ to B-
next 40 - 45% C+ to C-
bottom ~15% D to F

至少有40% overall score就pass到 但個median係C+ 整體上個grade唔算太好

我tutorial session嘅mean: 65.37%
我嘅overall score: 82.35%
最後拎A
reviews.comment_workload:
2次homework 第1份hw有sources冇難度 第2份要靠自己努力諗下 諗唔到可以問Kin Li/TA

2次presentations 1-3人一組 如果n個人一組就要prepare足n題 TA會點你名之後再揀題目叫你做

剩下嘅workload就係臨考前瘋狂刷題 一定要做嘅有past exam problems同past papers 而下面嘅presentation exercises題號係我覺得做左有用嗰啲 aim A嘅可以做埋 (不過夾埋past exam都差唔多160題 有付出先有成果)

Kin Li教書即係讀書，叫google translate讀都一樣，所以上唔上堂其實都冇乜分別㗎啦。不過佢個Review session一定，係一定要去，會講點樣做啲past paper，好有用。（會係canvas上講幾時會有，可能連續有幾堂review，要去齊）
仲有Kin Li人好好，問咩都會答，有咩唔識落堂去問，佢一定答你。如果Assignment唔識做嘅話就office hour過去問，佢會有hints比你，你都可以叫Kin Li 望下你份Assignment，佢會畀啲comments你。
哎，Kin Li 近來身體都差啦，記性差咗好多（唔記得自己寫咗啲咩，唔記得自己冇派卷，冇咗marking scheme答唔到問題，唔記得自己下個sem教咩course），上上下堂嗌膝頭哥痛，又因為有次食藥搞到眼訓，講幾分鐘嘢就要休息，見你咁都係畀個C你啦。

講返TA，佢哋都幾好人啊，send email即覆，tutorial都肯答問題。OK啦，算好嘅。

reviews.comment_workload:
Workload was honestly pretty light, as it was just homeworks and exams. There were two types of homeworks though: Type 1, which is the regular homework where you solve a few problems they give. Type 2 was weird though, since you had to copy the proofs of all of the theorems he taught, once before midterm and once before the final. It took me quite a bit of time (~40 pages each), but you didn't really need to think since you can just copy the lecture notes for all most all of the theorem.

If you have a solid math background, it's honestly very easy to do well, and there is almost no workload. However, for some people, it might take a bit of time to wrap your head around the different concepts, so it really depends on the person. Either way, this is nothing compared to MATH2043, which is super difficult imo.

reviews.author: USTAsiaNo1

reviews.comment_content:
it really covered a loooooooooots of contents
-
1. Using equivalence relation to construct R from Q from N
including:
Sets
Equivalence relation
Cauchy sequences and its convergence
Field and ordered field
Least upper bound property of R
Series and its convergence
-
2. and finally........... Topology!
-
a. Topology on R:
Neighbourhood and Accumulation point
Closed and open sets on R

b. Topology on metric space (a generalization of all the above)
What is metric
Closed and open sets on metric space
Neighbourhood and Accumulation point... and Isolated point, boundary, Closure... etc of sets on metric space
Complete metric space
Convergence of sequence (again!) on metric space
Uniformly convergence and uniformly continuous on metric space
Continuous function and Uniformly continuous function on metric space
Compactness on metric space
-
I tried my best to put these topics according to his teaching order

Syllabus:
- Simple Logic: Sets and Functions
- Countability
- Real Numbers: Supremum and Infimum
- Limit of Sequences: Cauchy Sequence, Limit of Functions
- Continuity
- Differentiation
- Riemann integral

頭兩個Topic算係一啲Elementary嘅知識，基本上唔會特別去考。
呢科係由Real Numbers嘅特性開始，由某幾個Axiom開始建立返我地1013 course學到嘅野。

最重要嘅Topic會係Limit of Sequence，因為基本上continuity同埋differentiability都係靠Limit of Sequence concept嘅延伸。

1013 1014嘅grade基本上代表唔到啲乜，因為純computation同Analysis係兩個世界，呢個course算係最最最簡單嘅introduction，但每年都死左好多人，特別係Local，因為DSE syllabus唔要求cover任何Analysis嘅野。
reviews.comment_teaching:
我最初有sit過LCM嘅Session（midterm前），我諗好多人都係慕名而來，咁我覺得佢嘅教學方式都唔錯嘅，係節奏上有啲快，因為佢想包多好多intuition，examples之類。上堂大多數都係講要用咩方向去解題，就唔多花時間去寫Proof，要自己睇返notes，對於一啲唔太識寫Proof嘅人有啲唔友善，但都唔錯嘅。

而張海其實教得唔錯，佢嘅速度係好慢，講野都有口音，但克服左之後其實都覺得佢講嘅野有啲料到，同埋佢講慢啲嘅話可以自己思考下，都唔錯嘅 ，但係就比較少例子，最好就做一做LCM Session嘅練習。

Midterm was easy. It was designed to help students to pass.
Midterm: mean around 40/45. Nobody can get 1sd above mean.
Final: (more difficult than midterm, full mark: 100)
Mean=35.37  SD=22.54  Highest=100  Lowest<10.

The grade is great.
99%homework+100%presentation+44.5/45midterm+65/100final => around 80.36% in total => A (I guess 80% is the cutoff for A)
reviews.comment_workload:
The types of problems in exams are nearly fixed. Get more experiences and learn more tricks to solve problems will help you in final. Also be careful.
Presentation: Groups are formed by 1 to 3 persons. Each group is assigned several questions. They will present the question in tutorial by projecting their solutions on the screen as well as telling the TA explanations. If you get stuck with the question, you are allowed to ask the TA.
Therefore, the workload is not high.

reviews.author: cdbn
reviews.comment_content:
这门课的主要内容:
midterm前:
- Countability
- Infimum-Supremum
- Limit of Sequences
- Limit of Recurrence Relations

midterm后:
- Cauchy Sequences
- Limit of Functions
- Continuity
- Differentiability
- Riemann Integrability 

作为分析学的第一门课，这堂课确实在我先前学的calculus上培养了更严谨和全面的认识。虽然很多证明和theorem（例如squeeze theorem和L’ hospital rule）都不在考试范围内，但强烈建议童鞋们好好学习，否则到了学实分析时就要花很多时间catch up这门课的知识。
reviews.comment_teaching: 只上了第一堂课。感觉上教授只跟着他的transparency念，所以不上课也行。
reviews.comment_grading:
HW1: mean 75.8, SD 33.3
HW2: mean 77.2, SD 28.0
midterm: mean 41.3/50，SD 12.9，highest 50
final: mean 31.1/100，SD 20.8，highest 100
本人: homework 全满，midterm 50, final 48 —> A-

final一共5题（当中有3题是挺不容易的），相信大部分人只能做到1～2题全对。本人2题全对，其它3题刷刷步骤分就得A-了。

这不算是一门适合抱大腿的课，因为考前刷题时看了解答后，都经常会误以为自己会解了，但也许不明白为什么要那么解。建议在看解答前先花时间解一遍，又或是看了解答后，在不refer解答的情况下自己写出来。
reviews.comment_workload:
大部分童鞋会花很长时间写作业，不是因为题目难，而是因为大家还不熟悉写proof的方法，之后刷刷题很快就习惯了。建议找几位大神朋友一起上这门课，方便讨论答案。

至于tutorial的presentation，只要求一学期present两道证明题，所以workload不算大。

reviews.author: ggnai
reviews.title: bad teaching, but grading is fine
reviews.comment_content:
This course doesn't cover so many things and it's quiet easy to follow. The topics are already covered in math 1013&1014, but this course focuses more on the proof of theorems.
1. some simple logic
2. set and function
3. countability
4.real numbers
5. limits of sequence
6.limits of functions
7.continuity
9.differentiation
10.Riemann integral
reviews.comment_teaching: I don't like prof's teaching because he just read his note and didn't elaborate or explain much.I just attended the lecture in the fist two weeks. After that, I watch the recording with 1.5 speed.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of this course is quite good.
30% assignment
30% midterm(mainly focused on countability and limits)
40% final( mainly focused on Riemann integral and differentiation)
I got almost full marks in assignments
95/100 in midterm (mean 46)
39/100 in final (mean 26)
overall 73% and I got A-.
After final I thought I was a dead man because I can only completely solve one out of the four problems. Thanks to the lenient grading and the high score in midterm, I am still in A range.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 5 assignments in total. In each homework, there are 3 or 4 long questions. It takes some time to think out how to solve the problems. In all, it didn't take me much time to do it.

reviews.author: 數學研究生
reviews.title: 爛Grade Course
reviews.comment_content:
A lot of proof but not useful.

Initially, the professor introduces the logical things but not test in the mid-term or final exam.

A lot of theorems you have to remember by yourself. But most of them are difficult to remember since they are not commonly apply to the questions.

You don't know why do you need to do those kind of questions. For example, you don't know why do you need to show that there is no solution for f(x) by give f(f(x))=-x^9.

I think it's a course to play with Maths but with a lot of proof.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Professor just read the things out from the transparencies, easy to understand because the examples are very simple. But you can't do it in the presentation or exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Rubbish Grading, above mean but only C+, no need to say too much. Easy mid-term, very difficult final exam.

Be careful, no any step marks will be given, if you do it wrong, then no marks, no marks for steps. No Marks for steps. It's important so I say it three times.

So finally, very rubbish grade.

Homework cannot get full marks, good luck.
reviews.comment_workload:
Normal, each student has to give two presentations. 2 assignments need to be handed in. But not good, can't get full marks.

The past papers cannot let you get high marks in the exam. So, don't take this course if necessary.
